contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=April 2010}} {{Infobox Playboy Playmate | image = <!-- only free-content images are allowed for depicting living people - see [[WP:NONFREE]] - magazine covers are expressly forbidden --> | imagesize = 150px | caption = | name = Victoria Fuller | issue = January 1996 | birth_name = Victoria Alynette Fuller | birth_place = [[Santa Barbara, California]]<ref name=wkp /> | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1970|12|11|mf=y}} | bust = 36C"<ref name=wkp /> | waist = 24" | hips = 34" | height = {{height|ft=5|in=8}}<ref name=wkp /> | weight = {{convert|123|lb|kg st|abbr=on}} | preceded = [[Samantha Torres]] | succeeded = [[Kona Carmack]] | website = http://www.victoriafuller.com }} '''Victoria Alynette Fuller''' (born December 11, 1970 in [[Santa Barbara, California]], [[United States]]<ref name=wkp>{{cite web|url=http://wekinglypigs.com/cgi-bin/nand/search/pmstat?browse=%3A%3ACONFIG%3A%3Adatebrowse&key=1996&limit=0|title=Playmate listing|accessdate=9 March 2009}}</ref>) is an [[United States|American]] [[glamour model]], [[artist]], [[actress]] and [[Reality television|reality TV]] contestant. She was ''[[Playboy]]'' magazine's [[Playboy Playmate|Playmate of the Month]] in January 1996 and has appeared in numerous [[Playboy Special Editions]]. Nine years after her Playmate appearance, she posed for ''Playboy'' again in the May 2005 issue.<ref>http://www.victoriafuller.com/</ref> Fuller appeared on the [[The Amazing Race 6|sixth season]] of the television show ''[[The Amazing Race (U.S. TV series)|The Amazing Race]]'' with her then husband in 2004. Since then, she appeared on ''[[Battle of the Network Reality Stars]]'', ''[[Kill Reality]]'' and a reality-star edition of ''[[Fear Factor]]''. In 2009, Fuller and her husband, Jonathan, got divorced after a 14 year marriage. On October 6, 2006, she gave birth to their only child, Trease Alynette.<ref>Mentioned on ''Kendra'' (October 9, 2011).</ref> Fuller has been the nanny for [[Kendra Wilkinson]]'s son, Hank, since around 2009. She also currently stars on her show, ''[[Kendra (TV series)|Kendra]]''. She also pursues a professional art career, producing [[Pop art]] paintings, prints and sculptures based on the Playboy world. ==Notable TV Guest Appearances== *''[[The Amazing Race 6]]'' playing "Herself", (2004) TV Series *''[[Dr. Phil (TV series)|Dr. Phil]]'' playing "Herself" in episode: "A Dr. Phil Primetime Special: Romance Rescue" February 15, 2005 *''[[Whose Line Is It Anyway?]]'' playing "Herself" (episode # 4.24) January 31, 2002 *''[[Howard Stern]]'' playing "Herself" March 19, 2001 *''[[The Man Show]]'' playing "Herself" in episode: "Playboy Mansion" (episode # 2.13) September 10, 2000 *''[[Married... with Children]]'' playing "Model #2" in episode: "Torch Song Duet" (episode # 10.26) May 19, 1996 *''[[The Girls Next Door]]'' playing "Herself" Baby Shower thrown by Hugh Hefner's main girlfriend, Holly. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.victoriafuller.net/ The Art of Victoria Fuller] *{{playmate|victoria-alynette-fuller|Victoria Fuller}} *{{IMDb name|id=0298363|name=Victoria Fuller}} {{playmates of 1996}} {{The Amazing Race contestants}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Fuller, Victoria | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH =December 11, 1970 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Santa Barbara, California]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Fuller, Victoria}} [[Category:1970 births]] [[Category:American television actresses]] [[Category:American women artists]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:21st-century American actresses]] [[Category:Playboy Playmates (1990â€“1999)]] [[Category:The Amazing Race contestants]] [[Category:People from Santa Barbara, California]] [[Category:Actresses from California]] [[Category:Artists from California]] {{playmate-stub}}
